title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users track and visualize their sleep debt over time. This application allows individuals to monitor their sleep patterns and identify potential sleep deficits, promoting better sleep habits. It leverages TypeScript for a robust codebase and aims to provide a user-friendly experience for managing and understanding personal sleep data.

title: resume
description: This repository contains my resume source code written in LaTeX. It serves as a project showcasing my skills in typesetting and document creation using TeX. The resume is actively maintained and updated.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to facilitate efficient and transparent voting processes. This repository houses the codebase for a web application focused on enabling users to participate in polls and elections securely and easily, offering features such as user authentication, ballot creation, and real-time results tracking. The project aims to provide a modern and accessible voting platform.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard interface built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository serves as a practical example for learning and implementing dashboard layouts, data visualization, and interactive UI components within a Next.js environment. It's designed to be a helpful resource for developers looking to build similar applications.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project utilizing HTML and Python to create interactive map visualizations. This repository explores techniques for displaying geographical data and insights through user-friendly interfaces, falling under the broader topic of data visualization projects. It serves as a learning resource and potential starting point for anyone interested in mapping and spatial data analysis.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a web application designed to facilitate brainstorming and project planning, allowing users to collaboratively organize and prioritize ideas. Built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, this project leverages modern web development techniques to create a dynamic and user-friendly experience for idea management. It falls under the topic of project management, aiming to streamline the process of turning innovative thoughts into actionable plans.

title: jovian
description: The `jovian` repository hosts a CRUD application built with Python and Flask, leveraging PostgreSQL for data storage and styled with HTML and CSS. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of web development principles, covering topics such as database interaction, server-side logic, and front-end presentation, all orchestrated via shell scripts for deployment and management.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a user-friendly interface for visualizing and interacting with data from the Robofleet robotics fleet management system. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, this project offers real-time monitoring, data analysis, and control capabilities, making it an essential tool for managing and understanding robot fleet operations.

title: atg-world
description: The atg-world repository hosts a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. It encompasses a variety of web development concepts and showcases practical application of these technologies.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project leveraging TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, Express.js, and Vite.js to create a user-friendly interface powered by the Gemini API. This repository showcases a complete application built with modern web technologies, demonstrating how to integrate with the Gemini API and create a seamless user experience.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains projects focused on applying programming principles to finance. Explore various notebooks covering topics such as financial modeling, data analysis for investment strategies, and automation of financial tasks, providing practical examples and code for learning and implementation in the financial domain.

This project, built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, is a web application exploring [mention what the project explores/does if possible, e.g., data visualization techniques, a specific algorithm, or a user interface concept]. As a practical example within the broader topic of project-based learning, it demonstrates [mention key functionalities or features].

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase, designed for tracking IoT assets. This repository showcases a modern web application architecture, utilizing TypeScript for type safety, Tailwind CSS for rapid UI development, and Supabase for backend functionalities like database management and authentication. It serves as a practical example for learning and implementing full-stack web applications with a focus on IoT asset management.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML project focused on creating a visually appealing and interactive event calendar. This repository provides the foundational code for building a dynamic calendar component that can be easily integrated into web applications to display and manage events. It's designed as a practical demonstration of front-end web development principles and techniques.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool designed for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log data. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS for the frontend and backend, along with Shell scripts for utilities, this project provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and explore ROS logs, making debugging and understanding robot behavior more efficient. This project is generally categorized under the `project` topic.
